title: How to Add a Thumbnail to a Video on YouTube

steps.title: Open the YouTube Studio app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube Studio app. It's the white icon with a red gear. If you haven't already installed this app, you can download it for free from the App Store (iPhone/iPad) or Play Store (Android). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the menu icon ☰.
steps.content: Tap the menu icon ☰ . It's the three horizontal lines at the top-left corner.

steps.title: Tap Videos on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Videos on the menu. This displays a list of your videos.

steps.title: Tap the video you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the video you want to edit. If you have a lot of videos in your list, you can sort them by tapping Sort by to make it easier to find what you're looking for.

steps.title: Tap the Edit icon.
steps.content: Tap the Edit icon. It's the pencil at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the Edit icon on the video.
steps.content: Tap the Edit icon on the video. This time, the pencil icon you'll need to tap is at the upper-left corner of the current thumbnail. This brings you to the Edit Thumbnail screen.

steps.title: Select a thumbnail.
steps.content: Select a thumbnail. You can tap any of the three automatically-generated thumbnails to set one quickly, or tap Custom thumbnail to select an image from your phone or tablet. After selecting a thumbnail, tap Select at the top-right to confirm. Your thumbnail image should be about 1280 x 720 resolution, with a minimum with of 640 pixels. The image should be in the JPG, GIF, BMP, or PNG format.

steps.title: Tap SAVE to confirm.
steps.content: Tap SAVE to confirm. It's at the top-right corner. Your new thumbnail is now live.

steps.title: Open YouTube.
steps.content: Open YouTube. Go to https://www.youtube.com/ in your computer's web browser. Doing so will open your YouTube home page if you're logged in. If you aren't logged into your YouTube account, click SIGN IN in the top-right corner of the page, then enter your email address and password when prompted.

steps.title: Click your profile icon.
steps.content: Click your profile icon. It's the circular photo (or initial) in the top-right corner of the page. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click YouTube Studio on the menu.
steps.content: Click YouTube Studio on the menu. This takes you to the Studio page.

steps.title: Click the Content tab.
steps.content: Click the Content tab. It's on the left side of the page. You will see a list of your videos appear. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Edit icon on the video you want to edit.
steps.content: Click the Edit icon on the video you want to edit. When you hover your mouse cursor over the video, a pencil icon will appear. Clicking this icon opens the video for editing.

steps.title: Click Upload thumbnail to select a thumbnail image from your computer.
steps.content: Click Upload thumbnail to select a thumbnail image from your computer. It's under the "Thumbnail" header below the video description. If you'd rather choose an automatically-generated thumbnail image, click the image you want to use below the description instead.

steps.title: Select the thumbnail image and click Open.
steps.content: Select the thumbnail image and click Open . This uploads the image to YouTube Studio. Your thumbnail image should be about 1280 x 720 resolution, with a minimum with of 640 pixels. The image should be in the JPG, GIF, BMP, or PNG format.

steps.title: Click SAVE to save your changes.
steps.content: Click SAVE to save your changes. This button is near the top-right corner of the page. Your new thumbnail is now live.
